basics.name: Jacob Peterson
basics.label: Engineer
basics.summary: Graduate Student at USC, studying VLSI (M.S. in Electrical Engineering, Spring 2026)

work.name: Emerson
work.summary: Analog Electronics Design on Rosemount Pressure & Temperature transmitters. I also developed frameworks for HART and VISA instruments that enabled parallel advanced test automations.

work.name: Galois/Adventium Labs
work.summary: Model-Based Systems Engineering tools & workflow development. Heavy emphasis on Java backend and React/Angular frontend development, with some python in between.

volunteer.organization: Student Accessibility and Achievement, McGill University
volunteer.summary: Volunteer Lecture Notes Writer for various high-level engineering courses

education.institution: Viterbi School of Engineering, University of Southern California
Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, McGill University

awards.title: Honour's Program Admission
awards.summary: The Electrical Engineering Honours program is highly competitive with limited enrolment.

awards.title: Communication in Engineering, Excellence in Written Communication Award Finalist

publications.name: A Triangular Lattice Framework for Massive MIMO Pilot Decontamination Schemes
publications.summary: This paper proposes a distributed framework for simplifying smart pilot signal assignment in cellular massive Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MIMO) networks that aims to reduce the complexity of pilot decontamination that comes with high cell count.

projects.name: Systolic Array Matrix Multiplication
projects.summary: Design Project for EE 477 (MOS VLSI Circuit Design). Efficient 4x4 4-bit unsigned integer multiplication using CMOS and TG logic.

projects.name: Pipelined CPU Development
projects.summary: RTL Design of a proof-of-concept CPU in Verilog for EE 457 (Computer Systems Organization) at USC. Project executed in increments as in-course lab activities.

projects.name: Biclustering Methodology & Automating Dendrogram Cuts
projects.summary: Development of novel clustering techniques for classifying data by feature and observation ('biclustering') as well as automatically determining the number of clusters in a dataset (represented visually by constructing a dendrogram graph and finding a threshold to bisect the graph) using various Bayesian information criteria. This was my undergraduate thesis.

projects.name: Pipelined reduced ISA MIPS CPU development
projects.summary: VHDL pipelined design of a CPU running a cut-down version of the MIPS instruction set. Project was highly collaborative (6 engineers); I focused on Instruction Decoding and debugging sessions. Course project for ECSE 425 (Computer Architecture) at McGill.

projects.name: Microprocessors Tetrominos
projects.summary: 'Tetris'-style videogame port for the STM32L4 platform. Written using embedded-C with some assembly among 4 engineers. I wrote the RTOS I/O code for UART and sound. Course Project for ECSE 444 (Microprocessors) at McGill.

projects.name: Analysis of Adaptive FIR Filter Performance in Narrow Band Interference Suppression
projects.summary: Least-Mean Squares (LMS) and Recursive-Least Squares (RLS) filter development & hyperparameter tuning for narrowband noise in wideband communication. Project performed in cooperation with a graduate student; I focused on LMS and optimization. Course Project for ECSE 512 (Digital Signal Processing) at McGill.

projects.name: Transistor Amplifier Circuit Design
projects.summary: Common-Emitter BJT circuit design targeting an amplification of 50 V/V on a 10 kOhm load over a bandwidth of 10 kHz posing less than 1 kOhm input resistance, capable of operating on inputs of 1 VRMS with a voltage supply of 10V. Course Project for ECSE 331 (Electronics) at McGill.

hobbies.name: Machine Learning & Natural Language Processing
keywords: Keeping track of progress in LLMS/GPTs, running local inference on personal GPUs.

hobbies.name: Parallel Programming (CUDA, non-NVIDIA counterparts)
keywords: For Machine Learning, research calculations, and curiosity

hobbies.name: Running
keywords: Peachtree Road Race, Berkeley Half Marathon

hobbies.name: Piano
keywords: Classical Music (20 years experience) and Jazz. Maurice Ravel enthusiast.

hobbies.name: Language Learning
keywords: Le chouette vert (The green owl) is watching...
